fields.label: Authentic sources
fields.definition: Base registries used by governments to automatically validate or fetch data relating to citizens or businesses. It facilitates prefilling of online forms and the implementation of the ‘once-only principle’, which implies that governments re-use data to deliver services automatically.

fields.label: Automated service
fields.definition: eGovernment automated service

fields.label: Business Start Up Life Event
fields.definition: eGovernment services related to the life event: Business Start Up

fields.label: Individuals who are born in another EU Member State
Individuals who are born in non-EU country
Individuals with high computer skills
fields.definition: Individuals having ever carried out at least 5 of the following 6 activities: coping or moving a file or folder, using copy and paste tools, using basic arithmetic formula in a spreadsheet, compressing (or zipping) files, connecting and installing new devices, writing a computer program using a specialised programming language. Only those having ever used a computer were proposed the question.

fields.label: Individuals with low computer skills
fields.definition: Individuals having ever carried out only 1 or 2 of the following 6 activities: coping or moving a file or folder, using copy and paste tools, using basic arithmetic formula in a spreadsheet, compressing (or zipping) files, connecting and installing new devices, writing a computer program using a specialised programming language. Only those having ever used a computer were proposed the question.

fields.label: Individuals with medium computer skills
fields.definition: Individuals having ever carried out 3 or 4 of the following 6 activities: coping or moving a file or folder, using copy and paste tools, using basic arithmetic formula in a spreadsheet, compressing (or zipping) files, connecting and installing new devices, writing a computer program using a specialised programming language. Only those having ever used a computer were proposed the question.

fields.label: Individuals with no computer skills
fields.definition: Individuals having ever used a computer, but having carried out none of the following 6 activities: coping or moving a file or folder, using copy and paste tools, using basic arithmetic formula in a spreadsheet, compressing (or zipping) files, connecting and installing new devices, writing a computer program using a specialised programming language. Only those having ever used a computer were proposed the question.

fields.alt_label: SMEs with at least a basic level of digital intensity

fields.alt_label: Fixed Very High Capacity Network (VHCN) coverage

fields.label: Digital Post
fields.definition: Public administrations should allow citizens to receive mail in a digital format and help reduce paper mailing. Governments should provide the possibility to communicate electronically-only with citizens or entrepreneurs through personal mailboxes or other digital post solutions. This represents a novelty of the 2016 measurement.

fields.label: level: Above Basic
fields.definition: Individual having "above basic" skills in ALL the four Digital Competence domains included in the index: information, communication, content-creation and problem-solving.

fields.label: level: Low
fields.definition: Individual "without basic" skills in AT LEAST ONE of the four Digital Competence domains included in the index: information, communication, content-creation and problem-solving.

fields.label: level: Basic
fields.definition: Individual having at least "basic" skills in ALL the four Digital Competence domains included in the index: information, communication, content-creation and problem-solving, but no more than three above basic.

fields.label: No digital skills
fields.definition: Individuals that have not used internet during last 3 months.

fields.label: High sophistication
fields.definition: Usage of any of the following Cloud computing services: accounting software applications, CRM software, computing power.

fields.label: Low sophistication
fields.definition: Usage of Cloud computing services for e-mail, office software, storage of files, but none of the other medium-high sophistication services proposed in the questionnaire.

fields.label: Medium sophistication
fields.definition: Usage of Cloud computing services for hosting of the enterprise's database, but none of the high sophistication services proposed in the questionnaire: accounting software applications, CRM software, computing power. Include other non specified services.

fields.label: 5a Key Enablers - eID
fields.definition: eGovernment services related to Key Enablers - eID. A government-issued, electronic identification solution to determine if the use is who he claims to be. Using eID enables online transactions, saves time and reduces costs for all actors involved.

fields.label: 5b Key Enablers - eDocuments
fields.definition:
eGovernment services related to Key Enablers - eDocuments. An electronic document reduces offline 
paper processes by allowing citizens and businesses to send authenticated documents online.

fields.label: 5c Key Enablers - Authentic sources
fields.definition: eGovernment services related to Key Enablers - Authentic sources

fields.label: 5d Key Enablers - Digital Post
fields.definition: eGovernment services related to Key Enablers - Digital Post. Public administrations should allow citizens to receive mail in a digital format and help reduce paper mailing. Governments should provide the possibility to communicate electronically-only with citizens or entrepreneurs through personal mailboxes or other digital post solutions. This represents a novelty of the 2016 measurement.

fields.definition: eGovernment services related to Key Enablers - eSafe

fields.label: 5f Key Enablers - Single Sign On (SSO)
fields.definition: eGovernment services related to Key Enablers - Single Sign On (SSO)

fields.label: Regular business operations
fields.definition: A business life event related to the economic affairs domain, covering services around: tax and corporate finance, VAT and business changes. A total of 10 services are assessed under this life event.

fields.label: Moving
fields.definition: A citizens life event related to the housing domain, covering services around: find, adapt and move to new house, and moving and living abroad. A total of 8 services are assessed under this life event.

fields.label: Transport
fields.definition: A citizen life event related to the transport domain, covering services around: buying a car, and taxes, certificates and permits. A total of 9 services are assessed under this life event.

fields.label: Starting a small claims procedure
fields.definition: A citizen life event related to the justice domain, covering services around: preparing claim, issuing claim and monitoring status and appeal. A total of 6 services are assessed under this life event.

fields.label: Business Start-up
fields.definition: A business life event related to the economic affairs domain, covering services around: orientation, administrative requirements, basic registration, tax-related matters, insurance-related matters, hiring a first employee and request an environmental permit. A total of 16 services are assessed under this life event.

fields.label: Family
fields.definition: A citizen life event related to the social protection domain, covering services around: birth, marriage, personal documents and registering death. A total of 10 services are assessed under this life event.

fields.label: Career
fields.definition: A citizen life event related to the employment domain, covering services around: immediate actions for unemployed, guidance on additional benefits and allowances, maintaining applicable benefits, finding a new job and fulfilling duties being employed and retiring. A total of 19 services are assessed under this life event.

fields.label: Studying
fields.definition: A citizen life event related to the educational domain, covering services around: orientation, enrolment and study guidance. A total of 11 services are assessed under this life event.

fields.label: Health
fields.definition: A citizen life event related to the health domain, covering services around: obtain a European Health Insurance Card, applying for electronic health records. A total of 7 services are assessed under this life event.

fields.label: Citizen life events
fields.definition: The citizen life events are: Moving, Owning and driving a car, Starting a small claims procedure, Family, Career and Studying

fields.label: Business life events
fields.definition: The business life events are: Regular business operations and Business Start-up

fields.label: All research DGs of the European Commission
eDocuments
fields.definition:
An electronic document reduces offline 
paper processes by allowing citizens and businesses to send authenticated documents online.

fields.label: Life Events for Businesses
fields.definition: The indicator is calculated for the basic services (therefore excluding extended services) of the life events of “Regular business operations” and “Starting-up a business”. These life events are calculated in alternate years. Therefore, each year the indicator will be a (moving) average of the latest available year of data for each indicator.

fields.label: All Life Events
fields.definition:
Biennial average over 9 life events. Life events are packages of government services which are usually provided by multiple government agencies around a subject that occur in relation each other, from the perspective of the citizen or entrepreneur concerned. In other words, life events are chains of services that are logically coherent from the perspective of actual users.
5 life events being measured in odd years (e.g.2021, 2023) and 4 life events in even years (2020, 2022). 
Odd years life events consist of: Regular business operations;  Transport; Starting a small claims procedure; Moving; and Health. Even years life events consists of: Business Start-up; Career; Studying and Family. 
* Health life event was introduced in 2021

fields.label: eID
fields.definition: A government-issued, electronic identification solution to determine if the use is who he claims to be. Using eID enables online transactions, saves time and reduces costs for all actors involved.

fields.label: PSI events and activities
fields.definition: PSI-related vents and activities (3 indicators: some national or inter-regional events; a moderate number of national or inter-regional events; a considerable number of national or inter-regional events)

fields.label: PSI use of exclusive arrangements
fields.definition: PSI exclusive arrangements (3 indicators: prohibition of exclusive arrangements; legal action against exclusive arrangements; ending exclusive arrangements)

fields.label: PSI formats
fields.definition: PSI dataset formats (4 indicators: endorsement of ‘raw’ data and open standards; obligatory ‘raw’ data and open standards; endorsement of ‘Linked Open Data’; existence of national or regional data catalogue(s))

fields.label: Implementation of the PSI Directive
fields.definition: Implementation of the PSI Directive (2 indicators: implementation and absence of infringement procedures and exemptions granted)

fields.label: Local and regional PSI availability and open data communities
fields.definition: Local and regional PSI availability and open data communities (3 indicators: some local or regional PSI available and community activity; moderate local or regional PSI available and community activity; considerable local or regional PSI available and community activity)

fields.label: National PSI re-use practice
fields.definition: National PSI re-use policy (5 indicators: general right of re-use; distinction between commercial and non-commercial re-use; redress mechanisms; pro-active publishing of PSI for re-use; availability of standard licences)

fields.label: PSI pricing
fields.definition: PSI pricing (3 indicators: cost-recovery model or marginal costing model; no exceptions to marginal costing model)

fields.label: Grade 11 (Upper secondary, vocational)
fields.definition: Students enrolled are at the eleventh year of schooling, counting from the first year of Primary - ISCED level 1. Mean age of students in Grade11 is at least 16,5 years.

fields.label: Grade 11 (Upper secondary, general)
fields.definition: Students enrolled are at the eleventh year of schooling, counting from the first year of Primary - ISCED level 1. Mean age of students in Grade11 is at least 16,5 years.

fields.label: Grade 4 (Primary school)
fields.definition: Students enrolled are at the fourth year of schooling, counting from the first year of Primary - ISCED level 1. Mean age of students in Grade4 is at least 9,5 years.

fields.label: Grade 8 (Lower secondary)
fields.definition: Students enrolled are at the eighth year of schooling, counting from the first year of Primary - ISCED level 1. Mean age of students in Grade8 is at least 13,5 years.

fields.definition: The citizen life events are: Transport; Starting a small claims procedure; Moving; and Health; Career; Studying and Family. * Health life event was introduced in 2021

fields.definition: The business life events are: Regular business operations and Business Start-up

fields.label: All Life Events

fields.label: Edge nodes deployment target per member state (indicative)
fields.definition:
High-level estimation on the distribution of edge nodes required per Member State to reach the 2030 European target (10.000 Edge nodes deployed across EU territory). 

It offers an indicative value for member states Edge deployment ambitions.
